paragraphs.text: Pope Francis, Salman Rushdie and Charlie Hebdo.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: There is some common ground, but not much
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The killings in Paris last week were horrifying crimes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that expose the vulnerability of democratic societies to lethal vigilante violence, whether facilitated from outside or as a spontaneous expression of homegrown psychopathic alienation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Beyond this morbid reality associated with the murder of the Charlie Hebdo cartoonists, police officers, and the supermarket hostages, there is nothing but darkness
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in that darkness some additional monsters lurk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We can be thankful once more for the moral clarity of Pope Francis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who in the impromptu setting of a plane taking him from Sri Lanka to Manila shined some light on the darkness
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Unlike those who so ardently wielded the slogan "Je Suis Charlie", the pope understood that free speech without limits is an invitation to indulge the worst negative impulses that will then operate as viruses destroying the vital organs of the body politic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What Pope Francis underscored was the impossibility of reconciling dignity with hurtful insults
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He illustrated his view by saying that if his companion on the plane, Dr Alberto Gazparri, a Vatican official, were to insult Francis' mother, he could expect to be punched
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He called such behaviour normal:"It's normal. It's normal. You cannot provoke. You cannot insult the faith of others."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Perhaps, this is too strong an expression of limits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it does indirectly raise the Derrida urgent question of learning to "live together" in peace and with respect within globalising social space
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Response to provocation
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Francis goes on to say that to kill in response to provocation, however severe, is not compatible with religion properly understood
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It is behaviour of "deviant forms of religion"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He goes on to say"To kill in the name of God is an aberration"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: At the same time
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: how lines are drawn with respect to acceptable and unacceptable forms of provocation is highly political and culturally influenced
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In one respect, France and other governments understand both sides of this argument, but twist it for political purposes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The popular comedian Dieudonne is being currently prosecuted in France for"defending terrorism"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because his humour deeply offends Jews, Zionists, and Israel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are no less than 54 cases in the country associated with "condoning terrorism"
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The Associated Press reports that just now "France ordered prosecutors around the country to crack down on hate speech, anti-Semitism, and glorifying terrorism"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: note no message by the French government is sent mentioning "hate cartooning" or addressing the surge of "Islamophobia" in the country in the days following the January 7 attack on the Charlie Hebdo editorial offices
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A large number of mosques in France and elsewhere in Europe have been desecrated in the last week
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This kind of double standards performs a variety of insidious functions for the French state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It uses the language of "terrorism" to demonise its political enemies and "free speech" to immunise its political friends
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It merges the criminalisation of anti-Semitism with strong criticisms of Israel along with any advocacy of boycott, divestment, and sanctions (BDS)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And it makes it even clearer to Muslims that they are fair game for Islamophobes and xenophobes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In effect, a French political community is being upheld that seeks to include Jews as valued and protected members while reinforcing the Muslim understanding that their residences and social standing can be fully understood by reference to the no-go banilieus of the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Salman Rushdie's ordeals
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: In the wake of these events, there is a new sympathetic look back at the ordeals of Salman Rushdie endured after the publication of his satirical novel "The Satanic Verses" in 1988
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Rushdie, appearing as a guest on Bill Maher's talk show and delivering a lecture at the University of Vermont, understandably defended freedom of expression as an absolute right
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: His words, deeply felt, are worth heeding as the counterpoint to the views expressed by Pope Francis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "And so artists who ... push outwards often find very powerful forces pushing back
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They find the forces of silence opposing the forces of speech
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The forces of censorship against the forces of utterance ... At that boundary is that push-and-pull between more and less
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And that push and pull can be very dangerous to the artist
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And many artists have suffered terribly for that."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The context of Rushdie's recent remarks was the Charlie Hebdo incident
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his outlook was intended to be sweeping in its generality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he did not, nor did Bill Maher, pause to take note of those powerful forces in the West
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: that have tried to shut down critics of Israel by shouting "anti-Semite" at the top of their lungs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Without some degree of consistency it is difficult to consider clearly the societal choice at stake
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What makes this confrontation so difficult to resolve is that it engages two truths, not one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The beginning of ethical credibility is to insist upon consistency
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Either
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Rushdie and France have to abide by the unsavoury views of Dieudonne as well as those of Charlie Hebdo
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: or
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it should suppress them both
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it allows both
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then it is opting for the Rushdie view
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that members of a modern society must learn to live with the extremes of cultural freedom
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: hurtful
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it allows neither then it is choosing to protect the sensibilities of minorities and others
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: whose dignity is under attack
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there are many compromises that can be made to ensure maximum freedom of expression while acknowledging certain limits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The US Supreme Court long ago decided that free speech does entitle someone to yell "fire" in a crowded theatre
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is what courts are for
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: to draw these lines in specific cases, balancing opposing truths in the light of practicality and the evolving values of the community
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What a judicial body had to say about race or homosexuality a century ago is different than what it says today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as we in the US know too well
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the prevailing ideology among the justices is often of greater importance to determining how such lines are drawn than are the legislative or constitutional enactments being interpreted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In some respects, then, such determinations are more part of the problem than of the solution
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abstract sentiments
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I find myself siding with the abstract sentiments of Pope Francis, but with Rushdie's view of minimising the role of law and the state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In this respect
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we impose limits by way of government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: we are entering the domain of censorship
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the same time
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we need to protect individuals and groups against malicious forms of defamation and hateful attacks on identities without confusing such protection with efforts to channel public awareness in certain prescribed directions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My own experience suggests that "freedom" of this sort has been used by some pro-Zionist and pro-Israeli organisations to discredit and deter and criticism of Israel, and especially of Israeli state crimes victimising the Palestinian people
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In Rushdie's case we need to protect his right to publish "The Satanic Verses", while condemning the fatwa imposing a death sentence for blasphemy and apostasy, yet upholding the right of non-western political communities to prohibit distribution of such a book because of its provocative nature in certain civilisational settings
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obviously, there are no cookie cutter answers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The proper limits are a matter of history, ethics, cultural priorities, and circumstances
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I feel that the central question is raised by Derrida's inquiry into how we can learn to live together
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For me, living together, given the originality of our historical moment, involves the construction of overlapping political communities of destiny - from family to world, with a major focus on the national political community combined with a greater effort to establish a global political community so that challenges posed by climate change, nuclear weaponry, infectious disease, and world poverty can be addressed more effectively and humanely
paragraphs.label: assumption
